item.description:
The Director John Sayles will be in Hartford tonight introducing his new film.  I expect a crowd, so show up early.  John Sayles will introduce his film.

 

Cinestudio is thrilled to present the 17th film (including Eight Men Out, Passion Fish, and City of Hope) by director John Sayles. The New York Times describes Sayles as the “left-wing, baby-boom John Ford, spinning fables of the American character out of the threads of myth, memory and ideology,” - and it’s hard to imagine a greater compliment. Amigo takes place in the Philippines in 1900, as the U.S. army stages an invasion to liberate the local people from Spanish control - a war strongly criticized by Mark Twain. Veteran Philippine actor Joel Torre plays a mayor in the uncomfortable position of working with his American amigos (including Chris Cooper and Deadwood’s Garret Dillahunt); while protecting the rebel forces led by his brother. “I’m interested in the stuff I do being seen as widely as possible but I’m not interested enough to lie.” - John Sayles.
